title: (x) Yamanote Line "You are here" - Helvetica {Florian}
content:
Hi,

I'm trying to find out what typeface is being used for the roman alphabet "YOU ARE HERE" on these contemporary maps from Tokyo's Yamanote Line stations (run by JR/Japan Rail).

Any help would be appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414021514im_/http:/typophile.com/files/you_are_here_font_5621.jpg)
author: nikkinikki

comments.content: As in, Eurostile Demi, I believe.

Thanks malbright!

It looks pretty close, although there seems to be a small difference in the lowercase y:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414021514im_/http:/typophile.com/files/you_are_here_tokyo_3528.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414021514im_/http:/typophile.com/files/eurostile_5935.jpg)
  
(Eurostile Demi)

I don't know the right words to describe it, but that sort of step at the junction of the two strokes.

It's close enough for me, more for the record really.

Ever the cheapskate, probably my real question is can anyone suggest a free alternative?

Cheers,  
nikki

<cite>JR Tokyo Sta.</cite> is Helvetica.  
You asked for <cite>YOU ARE HERE</cite>, which is Eurostile.  
F
A free alternative for Helvetica is [Arial](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414021514/http:/www.ms-studio.com/articles.html).

Ah, sorry! Assumed they would be the same - my mistake.  
Thanks for the help everyone.

Strictly speaking, it is probably latin characters of [ShinGo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414021514/http:/www.morisawa.co.jp/font/fontlist/details/fontfamily007.html) (means “New Sans Serif” in Japanese), a Japanese popular modern sans serif font.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414021514im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Shingo_3898.jpg)

Of course, the latin characters of ShinGo is based on Eurostile but rounder than Eurostile.

BTW “YOU ARE HERE” set in ShinGo is condensed around 94%.

- Akira

ありがとうございました！

I'm definitely lusting after that now!  
Usually I'd be in the funky g camp but that slight rounding of the uppercase "o" is gorgeous!

どういたしまして。(You’re welcome.)

- Akira
